Dear Mr. Vogl:
Pursuant to our conversation of November 1st, may x officially inform
you of my intention not to recommend to tne Board of Trustees of the
Twin City Area ETV Corporation (KTCA-TV) that the corporation should
renew its membership in NAEb. >y reasons for this decision ar* as
follows:
1# The NAEb tabled a recommendation presented by its appro¬
priate committee to aid in the establishment of new ETV
stations. This resolution was endorsed by a tremendous
majority of the station managers assembled at Alle rten
House in August and by the committee itself. Yet, with
exceedingly brief consideration, it was denied. No sub¬
stitute to help ETV was even proposed. This was done in
the face of a clear warning by Commissioner Mack that re¬
served channels woula not be held for ETV stations if
action was not forthcoming to activate such channels,
2. Another reconmendation to provide help for ETV stations
desiring to raise money nationally was likewise summarily
declined, This was desired also by the majority of the
ETV station managers ana was approved by the committee
with but one dissenting vote. Again, no substitute to
help the ETV stations was proposed.
3. Since NAEB is dominated by a group of Midwestern Radio
Stations having little interest in ETV and apparently
no interest in the Community ETV stations, I cannot con¬
ceive it to be in the interest of such stations to con¬
tinue to support NAEB. As you know, KTCA-TV is not the
first community station to leave NAEB. In n$r opinion,
it will not be the last.
